title: China Central Bank Extends Gold-Buying Streak for Seventh Month
content: China’s central bank expanded its gold reserves for a seventh straight month in May, furthering its bid to diversify holdings despite ongoing price fluctuations.

title: Rio Tinto Eyes Bailout for Australian Aluminum Smelter, AFR Says
content: Rio Tinto Group is seeking a multibillion-dollar government bailout for its Tomago aluminum smelter — Australia’s largest electricity user — due to spiraling energy costs, the Australian Financial Review reported.

title: Taiwan Official Discusses US Energy Cooperation at Alaska Summit
content: Taiwan’s top presidential aide discussed energy cooperation with US officials at a summit this week in Alaska, where a liquefied natural gas project has come into focus for potential exporting to the island.

title: Stocks Hit Highest Since February on Jobs Surprise | The Close 6/06/2025
content: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Katie Nixon, Northern Trust, Betsey Stevenson, University of Michigan, Dan Dolev, Mizuho, Rashad Bilal & Troy Millings, Earn Your Leisure, Matthew Griffin, Bloomberg News, Barry Bannister, Stifel, Jess Menton, Bloomberg News, Ed Ludlow, Bloomberg News, Stacy Rasgon, Bernstein Research, Frances Katzen, Douglas Elliman, Brett Winton, Ark Invest, Tony Zaccario, Stretch Zone, Nicole Camarre, 43North. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Best of the Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg
content: The Best of the Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg - bringing together some of the world's most influential thinkers, policy makers and business leaders to discuss how the global economy is transforming amid the changing geopolitical landscape, as Gulf nations emerge as key centers of financial power and opportunity. This special Bloomberg program highlights biggest interviews and news makers from the fifth edition of the annual forum that took place on May 20, 2025 in Doha. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US-China Future, Cheap Gas, UK Losing Millionaires, Investing in Big Law | Wall Street Week
content: This week, former Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers and Hoover Institution’s Niall Ferguson debate US and China's "hostile codependence." And, as President Trump touts lower gasoline prices, some experts explain why it’s concerning. Plus, more millionaires in the UK are packing their bags for Italy, but will it be for good? Later, how will private equity change Big Law? (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Peloton CEO Says He Has No Interest in Selling the Company
content: Peloton CEO Peter Stern joins Bloomberg's Mark Gurman at the Bloomberg Tech Summit to talk the company's growth goals, its use of AI, and why he is not interested in selling. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: S&P Dow Jones Leaves S&P 500 Unchanged in Rebalance
content: S&P Dow Jones Indices left membership in the S&P 500 unchanged in its latest round of quarterly rebalancing on Friday, according to a company spokesperson.

title: Finance Chief Signals That Colombia Will Suspend Fiscal Rule
content: Colombian Finance Minister German Avila signaled that the nation will suspend its fiscal anchor and also called for substantial interest rate cuts.

title: Earn Your Leisure CEOs Unveil the Invest Fest Lineup
content: INTV - Rishad Bilal & Troy Millings - Earn Your Leisure, Co-CEOs & Co-Founders speak with Alix Steel and Romaine Bostick about Invest Fest 2025 and navigating today's market. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Austria Rating Cut to Record Low by Fitch as Budget Woes Persist
content: Austria’s sovereign credit was cut by Fitch Ratings to two steps below the top mark for the first time, handing the government another setback in its bid to repair the country’s finances.

title: UMichigan Economist on "B+" Jobs Report
content: Betsey Stevenson, University of Michigan, Professor of Economics and Public Policy speaks with Alix Steel and Romaine Bostick about the US jobs report. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Crypto-Wallet Spat Ends With World Liberty Buying Memecoin
content: Eric Trump signaled that the tension between the competing factions of Donald Trump’s crypto empire has cooled and the family’s World Liberty Financial will buy a “substantial’ amount of the memecoin at the center of the dispute.

title: Ark Chief Futurist on Musk-Trump Rift’s Impact on Tesla
content: Ark Invest Chief Futurist Brett Winton discusses the outlook for Tesla amid the current rift between President Donald Trump and Elon Musk. He speaks on “Bloomberg The Close.”

title: Trump Discouraging International Students From Studying in US: Feldblum
content: Harvard University won a temporary reprieve from President Donald Trump’s ban on its international students entering the US, a legal setback for the administration in its high-profile fight with the school. Presidents' Alliance on Higher Ed and Immigration President Miriam Feldblum has more on the story.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Tesla Shares Caught in the Middle of Musk-Trump Breakup
content: When President Donald Trump won the election in November, investors viewed Tesla Inc. as one of the biggest winners. That bet now seems to be on shaky ground after investors watched the once formidable alliance dissolve in real time.

title: Yield Rise After Strong Jobs Report | Real Yield 6/6/2025
content: Sonali Basak highlights the market-moving news you need to know. Today's guests: JPMorgan Asset Management Global FICC US CIO Kay Herr, Invesco Head of Fixed Income Business Strategy and Development Stephanie Larosiliere, HSBC Americas Head of Debt Capital Markets Patrice Altongy, and Barings High Yield Portfolio Manager Michael Best. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Musk-Trump Breakup Exposes Cracks in Wall Street’s Meme Casino
content: It took less than a day for the great Donald Trump-Elon Musk split to reshape debates over billionaire power and influence in American capitalism.

title: Fans Line Up for Nintendo Switch 2
content: Bloomberg’s Cecilia D'Anastasio explains what is behind the excitement for Nintendo’s Switch 2. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Top Parkland Holder Backs Sunoco Deal, Urges Others to Follow
content: The top shareholder in Parkland Corp. said it supports the Canadian fuel distributor’s proposed takeover by Sunoco LP, describing the deal as a turning point for the company.

title: Stablecoin Firm Circle Surge From IPO Hits 247% on Day Two
content: Circle Internet Group’s shares continued to soar on Friday, sending the stock 247% above the IPO price in the stablecoin issuer’s second day as a public company.

title: Stocks Hit Highest Since February on Jobs Surprise: Markets Wrap
content: Stocks closed at their highest since February and bond yields rose as jobs data allayed concerns of an imminent economic slowdown. Equities also gained amid hopes US-China trade tensions are easing, with President Donald Trump saying negotiators will talk Monday.

title: Revelation-Backed Omada Health Jumps After $150 Million IPO
content: Omada Health Inc. shares ended their debut trading day exactly where they started after the digital health-care company raised $150 million in its initial public offering.

title: Banks Launch $1.5 Billion Loan for Silver Lake’s Altera Stake
content: A group of banks led by Barclays Plc launched a $1.5 billion loan sale to support Silver Lake Management’s acquisition of a majority stake in programmable chips unit Altera Corp. from Intel Corp., according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: Traders Reel In Fed Cut Bets as Strong Job Data Drags on Bonds
content: Treasuries slumped after stronger-than-expected US job and wage growth prompted traders to trim bets that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates this year.

title: S&P 500 Hits 6,000 on Jobs Data, US-China Trade Talks Optimism
content: The S&P 500 closed above 6,000 on Friday for the first time since February as stronger-than-expected jobs data eased fears about a slowdown in the economy and as planned US-China trade talks revived investor optimism.

title: Markets Saying Fed Rate Cut Premature: JPMorgan’s Herr
content: JPMorgan’s Asset Management Global FICC US CIO Kay Herr says the market sees a rate cut as premature, while President Trump is calling for it right now. Invesco Head of Fixed Income Business Strategy and Development Stephanie Larosiliere says we’re taking the jobs numbers “with a grain of salt.” They speak with Sonali Basak on “Real Yield.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Hedge Funds Hike Bullish Oil Bets Amid Canada Wildfire Risk
content: Hedge funds boosted their bullish stance on US crude by the most in five months as wildfires endangered Canadian flows and OPEC+ increased production less than some had feared.

title: Robinhood Extends Rally as Speculation Over S&P 500 Inclusion Grows
content: Robinhood Markets Inc. shares extended gains into a sixth straight day as investors speculate that the online brokerage could become the latest firm to earn a coveted spot in the S&P 500 Index.

title: Circle Shares Surge After IPO
content: Matt Oguz, founding partner of Venture Science and a Circle investor, explains why he thinks the IPO came at the right time. Oguz joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump’s Patience With Putin Leaves Senate Sanctions Push on Hold
content: President Donald Trump’s suggestion that he may let Russia and Ukraine keep fighting has left US lawmakers in an awkward spot over their plan to force a ceasefire with “bone-crushing” sanctions against Moscow.

title: Indian Delegate Says Pakistan Must End Terror Camps Before Talks
content: A senior Indian lawmaker said his government should not hold talks with Pakistan after their worst military confrontation in decades until action is taken to close down what he called terrorist training camps in the country, and that the US should not be involved as a mediator.

title: Dutch Far-Right Leader’s Bid for More Power Risks Flopping
content: Geert Wilders is betting that triggering the collapse of an unloved Dutch government will position him to emerge stronger and become the nation’s dominant political figure, but signs are emerging that the far-right leader’s gambit could backfire.

title: Starmer’s Tilt Left to Appease Labour Rebels Exposes Tensions
content: Keir Starmer has spent most of his time as prime minister warning about Britain’s dire finances and pushing divisive spending cuts. Nearing the first anniversary of Labour’s big victory, the prime minister appears to be pivoting to loosen his grip on the public purse.

title: Taiwan Official Discusses US Energy Cooperation at Alaska Summit
content: Taiwan’s top presidential aide discussed energy cooperation with US officials at a summit this week in Alaska, where a liquefied natural gas project has come into focus for potential exporting to the island.

title: Stun Grenades, Armored Trucks in ICE Raids Spur Tensions
content: The Trump administration is intensifying efforts to round up migrants and it’s using increasingly aggressive tactics.

title: Japan Won’t Wait for G-7 Summit for Possible US Trade Deal
content: Japan won’t necessarily wait for the Group of Seven Summit set to take place in Canada next week to seal a trade deal with the US if the two sides can agree earlier, Japan’s top negotiator Ryosei Akazawa said in Washington DC on Friday.

title: Abrego Garcia Charged With Illegally Transporting Migrants
content: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the Maryland man mistakenly deported by the Trump administration to a prison in El Salvador, has been brought back to the US to face federal charges that he illegally transported undocumented immigrants within the country.

title: Court Rules Trump Can Exclude Journalists From Oval Office
content: A federal appeals court has ruled that President Donald Trump can exclude journalists from the Oval Office, Air Force One and other “restricted” spaces based on their editorial decisions, handing the administration a win in its fight with the Associated Press over access.

title: South Korea Says Trump Agrees to Ramp Up Tariff Talks With Lee
content: South Korea said newly elected President Lee Jae-myung spoke for the first time with Donald Trump and agreed to seek “tangible results” in trade negotiations, after the US leader imposed a 25% tariff on all imports from its Asian ally.

title: Trump Pressures Fed’s Powell to Cut Rates ‘A Full Point’
content: President Donald Trump urged the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates by a full percentage point, intensifying his pressure campaign against Chair Jerome Powell.

title: Trump Says Xi to Restart Rare Earth Flows, Sets Date for Talks
content: President Donald Trump said his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping had agreed to restart the flow of rare-earth materials, as negotiators from the two nations prepare to resume trade talks on June 9 in London.

title: Trump Gives Musk Silent Treatment, Will Consider Cutting Contracts
content: President Donald Trump said he had no plans to speak to onetime ally Elon Musk and added that he was still looking at canceling the billionaire’s government contracts — an indication that their public feud is far from over.

title: Supreme Court Leaves Intact Ban on High-Capacity Gun Magazines
content: The US Supreme Court turned away a fresh gun-rights appeal, refusing to question the District of Columbia’s ban on large-capacity ammunition-feeding devices.

title: Supreme Court Gives DOGE Access to Social Security Data
content: The US Supreme Court gave the Department of Government Efficiency access to sensitive Social Security information, lifting restrictions a judge said were needed to protect the privacy of millions of Americans.

title: Newsom Strikes Back at Trump After Reports of Federal Aid Cuts
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom shot back at the Trump administration after a report that the White House was considering cutting the state’s federal funding.

title: Tesla Shares Caught in the Middle of Musk-Trump Breakup
content: When President Donald Trump won the election in November, investors viewed Tesla Inc. as one of the biggest winners. That bet now seems to be on shaky ground after investors watched the once formidable alliance dissolve in real time.

title: Harvard’s Battle With Trump Reignites School Pride of Alumni
content: Jessica Tang has two degrees from Harvard University but barely donated directly to the school in two decades as a graduate. She’s even publicly criticized Harvard’s labor practices.

title: Xi Bets Trump Detente Leads to Future Wins on Chips, Tariffs
content: In the early hours of Wednesday, Donald Trump declared that Xi Jinping was “VERY TOUGH, AND EXTREMELY HARD TO MAKE A DEAL WITH!!!” Some 36 hours later, the US leader said he got what he wanted: A commitment to restore the flow of rare earth magnets.

content: It took less than a day for the great Donald Trump-Elon Musk split to reshape debates over billionaire power and influence in American capitalism.

content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Email our editors here.

title: Tesla’s EV Deliveries Are Seen Falling as Demand Erodes Sharply
content: Wall Street is reining in expectations for Tesla Inc. deliveries as the Elon Musk-run automaker struggles with waning consumer demand and the threat of reduced US federal incentives for electric vehicles.

title: Trump Signs Order to Boost Drone Security Before World Cup
content: President Donald Trump signed executive orders Friday to bolster US drone capabilities, including strengthening counter-drone tools ahead of major sporting events such as the 2026 FIFA World Cup and the 2028 Summer Olympics that will be hosted in the country.

title: Senator Calls for Closing Troubled ICE Detention Facility in New Mexico
content: Heinrich says conditions ‘have not improved and remain inadequate and inappropriate.’

title: Alleged Iran Money Laundering Network Hit With US Sanctions
content: The US imposed sanctions on a network of individuals and companies it accuses of laundering billions of dollars from illegal activities for the Iranian government, as the Trump administration continues its “maximum pressure” campaign against Tehran.

title: Tariffs, State Jabs Push Canadians to Ditch US Travel, Poll Says
content: Most Canadians say they plan to shun US travel this summer as the trade war between the two countries continues, according to a poll by Leger Marketing Inc.

title: Court Fight Over Trump Ending Tariff Exemption Goes Forward
content: A court fight over President Donald Trump’s decision to end a US policy that exempted small-value packages from China from tariffs is moving ahead over the administration’s opposition.

title: How Trump Is Going After International Students
content: President Donald Trump’s broad crackdown on immigration is spreading confusion and fear among the more than one million international students who attend US universities.

title: All About the ICC Case Against Israel’s Netanyahu
content: The International Criminal Court sparked an angry response from Israel in November when it issued arrest warrants for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the nation’s former defense minister for alleged war crimes in the Gaza Strip. The Israeli government denied the charges, saying its conduct in the conflict was in line with international law. Netanyahu’s office said the ICC’s decision was “motivated by anti-Semitic hatred of Israel.”

title: EU Seeks Deeper G-7 Defense Ties to Offset Trump’s Upheaval
content: The European Union is racing to strengthen defense ties with key Group of Seven allies as President Donald Trump pares back the US commitment to the continent’s security.

title: Does a Michelada Without Beer Still Taste as Sweet?
content: The non-alcoholic choices out there are getting better. Except maybe the wines.

title: Investing Africa: 'Verdict Is Out' on African VC Funding
content: Enygma Ventures Founder Sarah Dusek says that Venture Capital funding in Africa could get a boost in 2025 with investors potentially diverting their capital away from more traditional destinations. She speaks to Bloomberg's Jennifer Zabasajja. (Source: Bloomberg)

content: Taiwan’s Yageo Corp. said it would keep Shibaura Electronics Co.’s most advanced technology in Japan if it successfully acquires the artificial intelligence sensor maker.

content: Rivian CEO RJ Scaringe discusses the impact of the Trump administration's tariffs on the electric-vehicle industry and Rivian's spinoff of its micromobility business Also at the Bloomberg Tech Summit in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Elon Musk and President Trump Feud Impacts Tesla, SpaceX | Bloomberg Technology 6/5/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss the fallout between President Trump and Elon Musk, as Tesla stocks regain some of Thursday’s losses. Plus, the spat could impact U.S. space ambitions and SpaceX. The CEO of Anysphere, maker of AI coding assistant Cursor, also explains plans for its latest funding round. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Tesla Shares Caught in the Middle of Musk-Trump Breakup
content: When President Donald Trump won the election in November, investors viewed Tesla Inc. as one of the biggest winners. That bet now seems to be on shaky ground after investors watched the once formidable alliance dissolve in real time.

title: Trump Signs Order to Boost Drone Security Before World Cup
content: President Donald Trump signed executive orders Friday to bolster US drone capabilities, including strengthening counter-drone tools ahead of major sporting events such as the 2026 FIFA World Cup and the 2028 Summer Olympics that will be hosted in the country.

title: Harvard Gets Other Universities’ Backing in Trump Funding Fight
content: A group of 18 leading US research universities, including Princeton, MIT, Caltech and Johns Hopkins, asked a federal judge for permission to file legal arguments in support of Harvard University in its high-stakes showdown with the Trump administration over more than $2 billion in frozen grant money.

title: Perplexity, Google Bet Web Browsers Are a New Frontier for AI
content: Tech companies are rethinking web browsers for the AI era. But first…

title: Musk’s X Selects Polymarket as Prediction Market Partner
content: Elon Musk’s X and the cryptocurrency-based predictions market platform Polymarket are partnering to provide data-drive insights and recommendations derived from posts on the social media site to the predictions platform.

title: Commerce Sets New Rules for $43 Billion Broadband Plan
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick released new guidance aimed at reshaping a massive internet infrastructure program to connect the entire country with broadband service, ordering states to rework their initial coverage plans to deliver service at the lowest-possible price.

title: Switch 2 Arrives to Strong Early Impressions
content: Nintendo’s first new gaming console in eight years is so far leaving fans and pundits with positive reactions

title: Telefonica, Masorange Said to Hold Early Talks on Vodafone Spain
content: Telefonica SA and Masorange have held informal talks on a potential deal for Vodafone Spain, people familiar with the matter said, a move that could lead to further consolidation in the country’s telecom market.

title: Violent Extremists Post Anti-LGBTQ+ Bile in Response to Offline Events
content: US President Donald Trump displayed on the jumbotron during the 60th presidential inauguration parade at Capital One Arena in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, Jan. 20, 2025. President Donald Trump launched his second term with a strident inaugural address that vowed to prioritize America's interests with a "golden age" for the country, while taking on "a radical and corrupt establishment." Photographer: Kent Nishimura/Bloomberg

title: Deutsche Bank Explores Stablecoins and Tokenized Deposits
content: Deutsche Bank AG is examining stablecoins and different forms of tokenized deposits, as large financial institutions grow more confident expanding in the digital-asset sector.

title: Power CEO Says US to Lose AI Race to China Without New Lines
content: The question of whether or not the US wins the race with China to develop artificial intelligence will hinge on Washington backing the construction of power superhighways to move large quantities of electricity, according to one of the country’s biggest energy developers.

title: Broadcom Falls After Lukewarm Forecast Disappoints AI Bulls
content: Shares of Broadcom Inc., a chip supplier to companies like Alphabet Inc. and Apple Inc., fell after the company gave a lackluster revenue forecast for the current quarter, suggesting that the AI spending frenzy isn’t as strong as some investors anticipated.

title: Indonesia’s Sovereign Fund Weighs Role in Grab-GoTo Deal
content: Indonesia’s sovereign wealth fund Danantara is considering a role in Grab Holdings Ltd.’s planned $7 billion acquisition of GoTo Group, potentially allowing the country’s government to own a slice of an Asian internet powerhouse.

title: Everything Apple Plans to Show at Its iOS 26-Focused WWDC 2025 Event
content: Company set to highlight software redesigns as it remains on sidelines of AI revolution.

title: BYD’s Misfire With Price Cuts Sparks $20 Billion Stock Selloff
content: A renewed EV price war launched by BYD Co. has shaved more than $20 billion off its market value in just two weeks, as skepticism over the top Chinese automaker’s strategy takes some steam out of its big rally.

title: Dronemaker Destinus Seek Funds at Unicorn Valuation
content: Destinus, a drone company founded by a former Russian national that supplies weapons to Ukraine, is in talks to raise funds that would value the firm at as much as €1.5 billion ($1.7 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Lakestar Seeks to Raise a $300 Million European Defense Fund
content: Lakestar, a European venture capital firm that backed Spotify and Revolut, is pitching investors on a new fund dedicated to defense technologies, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Starlink Gets India License to Start Services, Official Says
content: Elon Musk’s Starlink Inc. has got regulatory approval in India, paving the way for rolling out its satellite internet services in the world’s most-populous country.

title: Uber CEO Makes Moves to Entice Customers to Use All His Services
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Natalie Lung looks at the strategy Uber Chief Executive Officer Dara Khosrowshahi described as the next steps for his company’s growth during an appearance at the Bloomberg Tech conference.

title: The SEC Pinned Its Hack on a Few Hapless Day Traders. The Full Story Is Far More Troubling
content: When a notorious gang of Ukrainian cybercriminals hit a crucial database, the regulator quickly downplayed the breach. One of the hackers says the system is still a soft target.

title: Bond Traders Consult Risk Bosses Daily to Prep for Next Storm
content: The turmoil that hit markets after Donald Trump’s Liberation Day tariffs may have faded, but the aftershocks roll on in the risk departments of some of the world’s biggest banks.

title: Hong Kong’s Platform for $166 Billion Pension Faces Glitches
content: Some Hong Kong pensioners migrating to a new electronic system for retirement savings have experienced glitches, raising concerns over the platform’s reliability as it enters a key phase of adding more users.

title: HSBC’s Private Bank Turns Overweight US Stocks on AI Hopes
content: HSBC’s private banking arm has gone overweight US stocks and neutral on those in Europe, flipping its view from earlier this year after a breezy round of earnings from US tech companies.

title: London’s Fintech Woes Spread as Wise Shifts Main Listing to US
content: Wise Plc just fired the latest warning shot for British bankers and lawmakers trying to get more IPO prospects to choose London — particularly in the fintech sector.

title: N26 Eyes New Round to Offer Partial Exit for Coatue, Third Point
content: German digital bank N26 is considering a new funding round at a reduced valuation that could allow some of its existing investors including Coatue Management, Third Point and Dragoneer Investment Group to recoup part of their investment, people familiar with the matter said.

title: HelloFresh Executives Face Growing Dissent Over Pay Ahead of AGM
content: HelloFresh SE’s management could be edging closer to a revolt on executive pay after failing to heed investors’ warnings for the last three years.

title: Kuaishou’s Shares Climb After Outlining Video AI Revenue Jump
content: Kuaishou Technology’s stock climbed to its highest level since March after the social video service said it expected annual revenue from video-generation platform Kling AI to hit $100 million by February.

title: Japan Won’t Wait for G-7 Summit for Possible US Trade Deal
content: Japan won’t necessarily wait for the Group of Seven Summit set to take place in Canada next week to seal a trade deal with the US if the two sides can agree earlier, Japan’s top negotiator Ryosei Akazawa said in Washington DC on Friday.

title: South Korea Says Trump Agrees to Ramp Up Tariff Talks With Lee
content: South Korea said newly elected President Lee Jae-myung spoke for the first time with Donald Trump and agreed to seek “tangible results” in trade negotiations, after the US leader imposed a 25% tariff on all imports from its Asian ally.

title: Trump Pressures Fed’s Powell to Cut Rates ‘A Full Point’
content: President Donald Trump urged the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates by a full percentage point, intensifying his pressure campaign against Chair Jerome Powell.

title: Trump Says Xi to Restart Rare Earth Flows, Sets Date for Talks
content: President Donald Trump said his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping had agreed to restart the flow of rare-earth materials, as negotiators from the two nations prepare to resume trade talks on June 9 in London.

title: Finance Chief Signals That Colombia Will Suspend Fiscal Rule
content: Colombian Finance Minister German Avila signaled that the nation will suspend its fiscal anchor and also called for substantial interest rate cuts.

title: Austria Rating Cut to Record Low by Fitch as Budget Woes Persist
content: Austria’s sovereign credit was cut by Fitch Ratings to two steps below the top mark for the first time, handing the government another setback in its bid to repair the country’s finances.

title: Court Fight Over Trump Ending Tariff Exemption Goes Forward
content: A court fight over President Donald Trump’s decision to end a US policy that exempted small-value packages from China from tariffs is moving ahead over the administration’s opposition.

title: Fed Appoints Michael Horowitz as New Inspector General
content: The US central bank appointed Michael E. Horowitz to head the Federal Reserve Board’s Office of Inspector General starting June 30.

title: Carney to Fast-Track ‘Nation-Building’ Projects Through Bill
content: Prime Minister Mark Carney announced legislation on Friday to fast-track “nation-building” projects in Canada and remove internal barriers to trade in an effort to shore up the country’s economy from the US tariff barrage.

title: Collapsing Immigration Makes US Jobs Data Harder to Read for Fed
content: A sharp decline in immigration is keeping a lid on the unemployment rate even as the economy slows.

title: Fed’s Bowman Says Big Banks’ Secret Ratings Will Be Reviewed
content: Michelle Bowman, the Federal Reserve’s incoming vice chair for supervision, says the central bank will soon address the “odd mismatch” between the confidential ratings of big banks and the lenders’ financial conditions.

title: Tax-Hike Pressures to Follow UK Spending Review, Economists Say
content: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is increasingly likely to have to raise taxes later this year as weak growth, higher borrowing costs and top-ups for public services put her fiscal rules at risk, economists warned.

title: What America’s Pizza Economy Is Telling Us About the Real One
content: Higher-end pies are still selling, but for lower-income consumers even frozen pizza is becoming a luxury.

title: A Fed Official Goes Hunting for Inflation Clues in the Heartland
content: Faced with tariff uncertainty, policymakers are turning more to anecdotal information to guide their decisions.

title: Trump Is Holding Back From Calling Out China Over Russia War Aid
content: President Donald Trump is holding back from pushing China to halt support for Russia’s war machine as he focuses on other issues in the relationship with its biggest geopolitical rival, according to US and European officials familiar with the matter.

title: Israel’s US Broker Sells Record Debt for Nation During Gaza War
content: Israel has raised a record $5 billion through its US-based broker dealer, Israel Bonds, since the start of the war with Hamas, boosting its ability to finance the 20-month ongoing conflict.

title: ECB Officials See Cuts Near End as Villeroy Hails ‘Victory’
content: The European Central Bank is approaching the end of its interest-rate cuts, according to two Governing Council members, as others declared inflation has been vanquished.

title: Indian Households See Inflation Staying Low, RBI Surveys Show
content: Indian households expect price pressures to stay low over the next 12 months, surveys by the Reserve Bank of India showed.

title: Nabiullina Urges Caution After First Russian Rate Cut Since 2022
content: Russia’s central bank chief struck a circumspect tone on the path of monetary policy after lowering interest rates for the first time in nearly three years.

title: US Jobs Report Points to Gradual Moderation in Labor Market
content: US job growth moderated in May and the prior months were revised lower, indicating employers are cautious about growth prospects as they weigh the Trump administration’s economic policy.

title: Here Are the Takeaways From the US Jobs Report for May
content: Here are five key takeaways from the US employment report for May, released Friday:

title: Chile Annual Inflation Slows, Keeping Key Rate Cut on Table
content: Chile’s consumer prices rose in line with expectations on the month in May, while annual inflation unexpectedly edged down, keeping an interest rate cut in play at this month’s central bank meeting.

title: Canada Adds Just 8,800 Jobs, Unemployment Rises to 7%
content: The Canadian economy eked out minor job gains, and the unemployment rate rose for a third straight month to the highest level since September 2016 outside of the pandemic.

title: South African Lawmakers Agree Schedule to Process Third Budget
content: South African lawmakers will spend the coming weeks processing Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana’s third draft of the national budget after a dispute within the coalition government over taxes saw two previous versions scrapped.

title: US Jobs Report Eases Worries About Economy
content: An employee works on the production floor at a precision optics manufacturing facility in Ontario, New York. Photographer: Lauren Petracca/Bloomberg

title: Lone Analyst Who Predicted Deep India Rate Cut Expects One More
content: The lone economist who predicted the Reserve Bank of India’s out-sized interest rate cut on Friday expects another smaller reduction before the central bank hits a pause.

title: US Household Debt Has Climbed to a Record — Are You Feeling the Pinch?
content: Are you worried about making your next debt payment? Bloomberg reporters want to hear your story.

title: Bond Traders Look to US Jobs for Signals of Fed Rate Path
content: Bond traders will dissect the May jobs report for any signs of a softening labor market as they gauge the timing of Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts.

title: BOJ Is Said to Consider Smaller Reductions to Bond Buying
content: Bank of Japan officials are likely to consider slowing its pullback from buying government debt at a policy meeting later this month, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Bessent Looks to Revamp Currency Monitoring After Damage Done
content: I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at the US Treasury’s semiannual foreign-exchange report. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: NASA Delays Next Flight of Boeing’s Alternative to SpaceX Dragon
content: NASA is delaying the earliest potential next flight of Boeing Co.’s troubled Starliner spacecraft to 2026, pushing back a key milestone for a vehicle meant to serve as an alternative to the Dragon spacecraft owned by Elon Musk’s SpaceX.

title: Tesla’s Head of Optimus Humanoid Robot Program Exits Company
content: The leader of Tesla Inc.’s Optimus program is leaving the company, according to a person familiar with the matter, injecting uncertainty into the humanoid robot effort that Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk sees as a significant part of its future business.

title: Tesla’s EV Deliveries Are Seen Falling as Demand Erodes Sharply
content: Wall Street is reining in expectations for Tesla Inc. deliveries as the Elon Musk-run automaker struggles with waning consumer demand and the threat of reduced US federal incentives for electric vehicles.

title: Tottenham Fires Coach Ange Postecoglou Despite Ending Trophy Drought With Europa League Title
content: Leading Tottenham to its first trophy in 17 years didn't prevent Ange Postecoglou from getting fired.

title: Walmart CFO Says Shoppers Remain Focused on Food, Essentials
content: Walmart Inc. said shoppers are still spending about the same as they did a year or two ago, with a focus on food and essentials over discretionary purchases.

title: Warburg Pincus-Backed Solar Mosaic Files for Bankruptcy
content: Solar Mosaic LLC, a provider of home solar loans that has private equity firm Warburg Pincus as a major backer, filed for bankruptcy on Friday in the face of market uncertainty over federal support of clean energy.

title: Airline Gol Makes International Push to Cut Brazil Risk After Chapter 11
content: Brazilian airline Gol Linhas Aéreas Inteligentes SA is ramping up international expansion as part of a strategy to boost growth and reduce dependence on its home market after exiting Chapter 11, Chief Executive Officer Celso Ferrer said in an interview.

title: China Approves Rare Earth Exports to US Carmakers, Reuters Says
content: China has approved temporary export licenses to rare-earth suppliers of the top US automakers, Reuters reported on Friday, citing unidentified people familiar with the matter.

title: UBS Vows to Stand By Strategy After Swiss Capital Demands
content: UBS Group AG said it won’t change it’s strategy after the Swiss government proposed strict new rules that could see the bank hold up to $26 billion in fresh capital.

title: Boeing Set to Restart Jet Handovers to China Amid Trade Spat
content: Boeing Co. has begun shipping commercial jets to China for the first time since early April, indicating a reopening of trade flows amid the long-simmering tariff war between the US and Asia’s biggest economy.

title: UBS Slams ‘Extreme’ $26 Billion Capital Demand in Swiss Proposal
content: UBS Group AG said it would examine steps to mitigate the effects of the Swiss government’s proposal for as much as $26 billion in fresh capital requirements, calling the demand “extreme” and vowing to continue its push to dilute the regulations.

title: Musk Opens His Empire to Multi-Front Risk by Feuding With Trump
content: What began as Elon Musk’s embrace of right-wing populism has become a defining — and potentially harmful — chapter in his business career.

title: Porsche Mulls Doing Some Final Assembly in US to Ease Tariff Hit
content: Porsche AG is considering shifting certain last parts of its model assembly to the US as a way to blunt the impact of Donald Trump’s tariffs on imported vehicles, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: What Next for UBS After Swiss Lay Out Capital Demand?
content: After more than a year of waiting, UBS Group AG finally has a clearer idea of how much money it will need to find if Switzerland forces the bank to take on more capital to deal with future crises. Now comes the effort to soften the hit.

title: UBS Confirms 2025 Payout Plans After Swiss Bank Law Proposals
content: UBS Group AG said it will carry out its plans to make payouts to shareholders this year as previously announced after the Swiss government published proposals for a reform of banking laws.

title: TotalEnergies Plans Stake Sales in US, Spain Renewables
content: TotalEnergies SE is looking to sell a 50% interest in a large portfolio of renewable assets in the US and is considering a similar stake sale for a smaller group of solar farms in Spain, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Lululemon Sinks Most Since 2020 on Slowing Growth Outlook
content: Lululemon Athletica Inc. shares fell the most in five years after a second straight disappointing quarter, fueling concerns that rising competition, new tariffs and a shift away from yoga pants are derailing its ambitious growth plans.

title: The Cup With a $1 Billion Prize Pot Few Know About
content: FIFA’s Club World Cup starts next weekend in the US, in case you hadn’t heard.

title: Health Care, Service Workers Report Highest Rates of Depression
content: Health care, social services, food preparation and personal care workers such as hair stylists and childcare providers reported the highest rates of depression among more than half a million workers surveyed nationwide, a study published Friday found.

title: Tesla Shares Recover Some Losses as Musk-Trump Tension Eases
content: Tesla Inc.’s shares rose Friday after Elon Musk suggested he was open to making amends with President Donald Trump, easing tensions after their simmering feud erupted into a public war of words a day earlier.

title: Swiss Regulator to Get Power to Fine Banks Under Law Proposal
content: Switzerland wants to give its financial watchdog the ability to fine banks, potentially boosting Finma’s enforcement powers after it failed to prevent Credit Suisse’s collapse.

title: Hedge Fund Taula Beat Out Two Rivals and Goldman Sachs to Poach Top Trader
content: A one-year-old hedge fund beat two of its top rivals to hire a veteran Morgan Stanley trader shortly before he was due to start co-running the volatility trading desk at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.

title: UK to Promote Solar Panels on All New Homes in Building Drive
content: The UK aims to put solar panels on all new homes as part of a plan to cut carbon dioxide emissions, lower bills and build over a million new dwellings in the coming years.

title: HSBC Eyes New Canary Wharf Office as Desk Shortage Mounts
content: HSBC Holdings Plc is in talks to lease several floors near its current headquarters in London’s Canary Wharf as the bank grapples with a looming shortfall of several thousand desks in the offices it’s moving into next year.

title: Carmakers Use Stealth Price Hikes to Cope With Trump’s Tariffs
content: Quiet cuts to incentives are boosting how much Americans pay for cars, even if the sticker price stays the same.

title: Boaz Weinstein Ready to Plow Billions More Into UK Trust Fight
content: Weeks after scoring a string of wins in his high-profile campaign for better returns from UK investment trusts, here is activist hedge fund manager Boaz Weinstein’s latest message for the industry: I’m not going anywhere.

title: International Influencer Crackdown Leads to Three UK Arrests
content: Influencers promoting financial products on social media have been targeted by an international investigation led by the UK’s Financial Conduct Authority.

title: US Targets Niche Gas That China Can’t Replace as Trade War Chip
content: The US is using its dominance of a niche petroleum gas as a bargaining chip in its trade war with China.

title: Japan Space Ambitions Dealt Blow After Ispace Moon Landing Fails
content: Tokyo-based ispace Inc.’s second lunar lander attempt failed after it lost contact, a blow to Japan’s burgeoning commercial space industry.

title: Malaysia’s Petronas to Cut 10% of Workforce on Profit Slump
content: Petronas, Malaysia’s state-owned oil and gas company, will cut about 10% of its workforce in a firm-wide restructuring as it looks to reduce costs due to falling crude prices.
